subject: PHYSICS
summary: This lesson will explore the various methods of energy transfer including mechanical, electrical, thermal, and radiation. Students will learn to identify examples of energy transfers in everyday life and understand the principles behind them.
contentItems: How energy is transferred (mechanically, electrically, by heating, by radiation).
learningObjectives: Understand the different methods of energy transfer.
Identify real-life examples of energy transfers.
Explain the principles behind energy transfers.
materials: Handouts with examples of energy transfers

starter.activity: Quick quiz on types of energy and their definitions.

mainActivities.activity: Group activity where students categorize different energy transfer examples.
Class discussion on energy transfer in various devices (e.g., light bulbs, engines).
Watch a video demonstrating energy transfers in nature (e.g., photosynthesis, heating in the sun).

plenary.activity: Recap the main types of energy transfer and ask students to share one new thing they learned.

assessmentMethods: Exit ticket summarizing one type of energy transfer and its example
Quick quiz at the end of the lesson

homework.task: Write a short paragraph describing an energy transfer process they observed during the week.

teacherNotes: Ensure all materials are prepared in advance. Be ready to facilitate discussions and encourage students to think critically about energy transfers.
